results.title: Mouth to mouth (AFC)
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, John Sainken, Vega Film Productions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two teenage girls escape from a youth training centre and head for the city finding work in a food bar. Eventually they end up sharing a derelict warehouse with two unemployed boys they have met, one from an Italian family and the other from the country, and for awhile the openness and warmth of their relationships transcend their depressing economic circumstances. This is a film about survival, interpersonal relationships and the inevitable disintegration of the group. Cast includes Kim Krejus, Sonia Peat, Ian Gilmour, Sergio Frazetto. Cinematography by Tow Cowan; Nigel Buesst as camera assistant.

results.title: Mountains, materials and technology
results.creator_credit: Mike Lockey, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Examines some of the latest developments to help people survive in hostile environments. Discusses the manufacture of new fabrics which have been used to design a new generation of tents, clothing and sleeping bags for surviving high altitude conditions. Also looks at how the use of a global positioning system can be used to help the lives of people stranded at sea or on land.

results.title: Mountains of adventure
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary looking at two very different mountain ranges and how they are conquered by a small group of Aussie adventurers. The group flew to India to trek into the hidden kingdom of Zanskar, far north of Delhi through the highlands, to altitudes over 10,000 feet above sea level. They then rafted down white water rapids to Shingo La Pass at the Zanskar - before travelling to Kashmir. The second leg of this extraordinary journey took them to the New Zealand Alps, where they were caught in the worst weather experienced on Mount Victoria over 45 years. An amazing rescue sequence follows.

results.title: Mountain lands in jeopardy
results.brief_description: The soil erosion caused by introduced animals in the mountains of New Zealand. The vegetation in the alpine country around the head-waters of the Waitake River has been destoryed by deer, hare and thar. Burning off the natural tussock to create sheep pasture has added to the problem. Erosion and flooding of valley farms has resulted.

results.title: Mount Isa copper
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the copper industry based at Mt Isa in Queensland. Introduces typical workers and a housewife living in the town of 14,000 people. Shows completion of refining at Stuart near Townsville of pure copper suited to electrical use. Commentary by Shan Benson.

results.title: Mount Buffalo National Park
results.brief_description: A summer-time study of one of Victoria’s most popular holiday resorts. Mount Buffalo provides facilities for snow sports in winter, and is ideal for hiking, fishing, climbing and cross-country walking in summer. Commentary by Terry Dear, photography by Roy Driver.

results.title: Motown 25: Yesterday, Today, Forever
results.brief_description: Hosted by Richard Pryor, this is a fast paced, all star reunion that spotlights performances by the biggest acts ever to come out of Detroit including vintage footage of the groups from the sixties and seventies. It looks behind the scenes into what made Motown tick, the songwriters who helped bring the Motown sound to fame and the man who started it all, the legendary Berry Gordy. Rated: G
